result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly E Herden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation in Count 1, Case 16CF502.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 06:00 p.m. on 06-20-2016.
Apply 4 days sentence credit.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Case 15CF1269 is dismissed and read in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly E Herden

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kelly E Herden in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

HUBER: 30 DAYS, w/Standard Release Conditions (Credit - 4 DAYS). Defendant to report to Huber facility by 6:00 p.m. on 6/20/16.

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF502).

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, (to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF502).

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Treatment letter filed.
Sentencing hearing on June 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
